title: Comparative Effectiveness of Expert Modeling and Self-Directed Modeling: Simulation/VR-Based Intensive Short-Term Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of social issue analysis and evaluation methodologies
context.additional_context: Simulation/VR-based education conducted in smartphone-centric, limited technology environments, measuring learning outcomes through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain the characteristics of expert modeling (EM) and self-guided modeling (SGM).
Learners can analyze the impact of expert models on problem-solving processes through simulations and write evaluation reports.
Learners can select appropriate modeling strategies based on their level of expertise.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
